author: m.kalinin
content: we can have MAX_ATTESTATIONS = 16 which will double the max size of attestations in a block. 8 is near to Phase0 in terms of size. Do you suggest to increase the max just for Holesky or for mainnet too?

author: arnetheduck
content: I would go for the same settings everywhere tbh .. the size argument assumes "full" votes for the same block, which is precisely what does not happen in a forked network - I think this is the flaw.

author: .paulharris
content: not sure we can unless we change network though, it'll be consensus breaking right?

author: arnetheduck
content: good point - then start with mainnet and do it in the next hf for the testnets

author: .paulharris
content: i could be wrong but at least old clients wont like it

author: arnetheduck
content:
the downside of course is double the number of sig verification and a tiny bit of space usage, can't think of anything else

based on mainnet today, _I suspect_ we'll see them fill up regardless - ie either to catch individual "stragglers" or because of attestation pool inefficiencies in clients

author: .paulharris
content: its a shame they remain valid so long honestly

author: .paulharris
content: but one thing at a time lol

I ordered the list in decreasing order of allocated validators (thanks <@1009418255913472000> !):
kiln (better but still loosing quite a lot) - 100k
<@495314142022860811> <@654267572107083777>   (about 50% failed) - 100k total
<@&595683609080365088>  (was good but now losing about 50%) - 100k total
rp-sters - 40k total
grandine - 25k validators
<@219015859182632960>   (also about 50%) - 20k
<@449019668296892420>   - 10k
google_cloud (better but about 30-40% missed still) - 10k
<@861807242156572722>  (100% missed) - 10k
<@539495253418180618>   (losing about 50%) - 5k

Frax Finance - <10k
Linkriver - <10k
Huawei - <10k

Getting this set up and running will give us between 15-20% more attestations on the network. This would bring us much closer to finality, so it'd be great if we can co-ordinate this set to start with and then re-evaluate on who else is offline.

author: nflaig
content:
We have managed to figure out a somewhat safe way to sync Lodestar from a unfinalized checkpoint state, in case your node is not synced this is something you might wanna try, the node should only take around 10 minutes to be synced to head.
- new image: `ethpandaops/lodestar:holesky-rescue-edab7f0`
- add `--checkpointState https://pub-3cd22dca6ea14e7a83ce8eb86685b16e.r2.dev/0x8ace010000000000847adec23f86a48d8b9a1f70b850235cebf966d127e1ac2c0e26e1dbcc047592`
This checkpoint state is from the following epoch / root
```json
{
  "epoch": "118410",
  "root": "0x847adec23f86a48d8b9a1f70b850235cebf966d127e1ac2c0e26e1dbcc047592"
}
```
see https://dora-holesky.pk910.de/slot/3789120

Make sure to remove `<dataDir>/chain-db` so that the node does not use the existing state in db.

We also bumped our default target peers to 200 as it does help to find peers for attestation subnets and improves % of attestation getting included on-chain.
